attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Is the PM actually listening to any of these petitions, I don’t see any policies changing? Most of the petitions on here contradict each other, which make drawing any conclusions almost impossible. Politicians won’t listen to the petitions, as they don’t represent a true cross section of voters, just who can put on the best PR campaign. Why can’t we sign up to disagree with petitions, or have the ability to make comments and have a proper debate?  

This site is a massive waste of time, distracts from the real issues out there and should be shut down. If the Government really wants to encourage electronic democracy then replace it with a site where people can vote for or against a suggestion and give their reasons why.  Alternatively use the space to host a video of Tony Blair standing on his head juggling ice cream and the lyrics to our new national anthem, ‘Gold’ by Spandu Ballet.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
